title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Pre-requisite: None Introduction to biomaterials; characterization of materials mechanical properties; thermal properties; surface properties and adhesion; the structure of solids classes and forms of biomaterials – metals, ceramics, synthetic polymers, composites, hydrogels; bioresorbable and biodegradable materials; natural materials, structure and properties relationships of biological materials; Foreign biomaterials – biological interface and reactions; biological response to implants; Polymer directed self-assembly of inorganic biomaterials – Biomimetics; Autografts, allografts and xenografts, composites, surface modification, 2D and 3D scaffolds for tissue engineering; Materials for artificial blood vessels, mechanical heart valves, breast implants, orthopedic joints, dental fillings, chin augmentation, devices such as intravenous catheters and drug delivery vehicles, intra-ocular lenses, burn dressings, sutures, biomaterials for soft tissue replacement; biomaterials for hard tissue replacement; biologically functional biomaterials;,testing and clearance of biomaterials; evaluation of biomaterials.
